Which of the following is the datum for altitude information when conducting flights under IFR conditions on airways using
the NAVSTAR/GPS satellite navigation system ?
choiceone: The average of GPS altitude and barometric altitude.
choicethree: GPS altitude if 4 or more satellites are received otherwise barometric altitude.

question: Which of the following is the ICAO allocated frequency band for ADF receivers ?

Which of the following lists all the parameters that can be determined by a GPS receiver tracking signals from 4 different
satellites ?

Which of the following lists all the stages of flight when is it possible to change the route in the active flight plan on an FMS
equipped aircraft ?
answer: At any time before take-off and throughout the flight.
choiceone: Only once the aircraft is airborne.
choicetwo: Only before the flight plan is activated.

question:
Which of the following lists are all errors that affect the accuracy and reliability of the Satellite-Assisted Navigation system
( GNSS/GPS ) ?
answer: Satellite clock , satellite ephemeris , atmospheric propagation.
choiceone: Satellite mutual interference , satellite ephemeris , atmospheric propagation.
choicetwo: Satellite mutual interference , frequency drift , satellite to ground time lag.
choicethree: Satellite to ground time lag , atmospheric propagation , satellite clock.

question:
Which of the following lists information required to input a waypoint or “Phantom Station” into a basic VOR/DME-based
Area Navigation System ?
answer: Radial and distance from a VOR/DME to the waypoint or “Phantom Station”.
choiceone: Radials from a minimum of two VORs to the waypoint or “Phantom Station”.
choicetwo: Magnetic track and distance to a VOR/DME from the waypoint or “Phantom Station”.
choicethree: Magnetic track and distance from the aircraft to the waypoint or “Phantom Station”.

question: Which of the following lists the phenomena least likely to be detected by radar ?
choiceone: Wet snow and turbulence in cloud that has precipitation.
choicetwo: Turbulence in cloud that has precipitation.

question: Which of the following Nav Aids will provide an RNAV system with position ?

Which of the following NAVSTAR/GPS satellite navigation system codes can be processed by “unauthorised” civil aviation
receivers ?

Which of the following procedures must be adopted if , on a flight under IFR conditions using a NAVSTAR/GPS satellite
navigation system receiver , the position fix obtained from the GPS receiver differs from the position of conventional navigation
systems by an unacceptable amount ?
answer: It may be continued using conventional navigation systems.
choiceone: The pilot must determine the reason for the deviation and correct the error or switch off the faulty system.
choicetwo: It must be continued under VFR conditions.
choicethree: It may be continued using NAVSTAR/GPS , prior to the next flight all systems must be checked.

question:
Which of the following radar equipments operate by means of the pulse technique ?
 1. Aerodrome Surface Movement Radar.
 2. Airborne Weather Radar.
 3. Secondary Surveillance Radar ( SSR ).
 4. Aerodrome Surveillance ( approach ) Radar.

Which of the following satellite navigation systems has Full Operational Capability ( FOC ) and is approved for specified
flights under IFR conditions in Europe ?

Which of the following statements about the accuracy that can be obtained with the differential technique ( D-GPS ) of the
satellite navigation system NAVSTAR/GPS is correct ?
answer: The nearer a receiver is situated to a D-GPS ground station , the more accurate the position fix.
choiceone: Only D-GPS allows position fixes accurate enough for “Non Precision Approaches”.
choicetwo:
The increase in accuracy of position fixes is independent of the receiver position in relation to a D-GPS
 ground station.
choicethree: A D-GPS receiver can detect and correct for SA providing a more accurate position fix.

question:
Which of the following statements about the accuracy that can be obtained with the LAAS ( local area augmentation system )
of the satellite navigation system NAVSTAR/GPS is correct ?
answer: The closer the receiver is to a LAAS ground reference station , the more accurate is the aircraft position fix.
choiceone: A LAAS cannot correct for satellite timing and orbital position error.
choicetwo: A LAAS corrects the position of the aircraft by relaying the information via a geo-stationary satellite.
choicethree:
The increase in accuracy of position fixes is independent of the aircraft position in relation to the LAAS
 ground reference station.

question:
Which of the following statements about the scalloping ( path deflection ) of VOR-radials , in relation to the accuracy of
navigation using a VOR/DME RNAV-system , is correct ?
answer: Scalloping has a negative effect on the accuracy of navigation.
choiceone: Scalloping has a positive effect on the accuracy of navigation.
choicetwo:
Scalloping has no effect on the accuracy of navigation because it only results in the movement of the needle
 of the Course Deviation Indicator.
choicethree:
Scalloping has no effect on the accuracy of navigation because this accuracy is independent of VOR or DME
 measurements.

question: Which of the following statements about the “visibility” of NAVSTAR/GPS satellites is correct ?
answer: It varies , depending on the time and observer’s location.
choiceone: It is the same throughout the globe.
choicetwo: It is greatest at the poles.
choicethree: It is greatest at the equator.

question: Which of the following statements concerning LORAN-C is correct ?
answer: It is a hyperbolic navigation system that works on the principle of differential range by pulse technique.
choiceone:
It is a navigation system based on simultaneous ranges being received from a minimum of four ground
 stations.
choicetwo:
It is a navigation system based on secondary radar principles , position lines are obtained in sequence from up
 to eight ground stations.
choicethree: It is a hyperbolic navigation system that works on the principle of range measurement by phase comparison.

question:
Which of the following statements concerning the L1 and L2 NAVSTAR/GPS transmission frequencies and codes is
correct ?
answer: The higher frequency is used to transmit both the C/A and P codes.
choiceone: The lower frequency is used to transmit both the C/A and P codes.
choicetwo: The higher frequency is only used to transmit the P code.
choicethree: C/A and P codes are transmitted at different times on both frequencies.

question: Which of the following statements concerning the variable , or directional , signal of a conventional VOR is correct ?
answer:
The rotation of the variable signal at a rate of 30 times per second gives it the characteristics of a 30 Hz
 amplitude modulation.
choiceone: The receiver adds 30 Hz to the variable signal before combining it with the reference signal.
choicetwo: The transmitter varies the amplitude of the variable signal by 30 Hz each time it rotates.
choicethree:
The transmitter changes the frequency of the variable signal by 30 Hz either side of the allocated frequency
 each time it rotates.

question: Which of the following statements regarding B-RNAV is correct ?
answer: For 95% of the flight time , the track keeping accuracy must not exceed 5 NM.
choiceone: B-RNAV is only applicable when flying in TMA’s.
choicetwo: In case of B-RNAV , RNP1 is required.
choicethree: B-RNAV can be used up to FL95. Above FL95 P-RNAV is required.

question: Which of the following will give the most accurate calculation of aircraft ground speed ?
answer: A DME station sited on the flight route.
choiceone: An ADF sited on the flight route.
choicetwo: A DME station sited across the flight route.
choicethree: A VOR station sited on the flight route.

question: Which of these markers has the highest audible frequency ?
Which one is the most correct statement regarding the range of the DME system ?
answer: Range within “line of sight” , and maximum 200 NM.
choiceone: Has unlimited range due to ground wave propagation.
choicetwo: Operates on the principle of phase comparison.

question: Which one of the following correctly lists the major ground based components of a Microwave Landing System ( MLS ) ?
answer: Separate azimuth and elevation transmitters , DME facility.
choiceone: Separate azimuth and elevation transmitters , outer and middle marker beacons.
choicetwo: Combined azimuth and elevation transmitter , DME facility.
choicethree: Combined azimuth and elevation transmitter , outer and inner marker beacons.

question: Which one of the following disturbances is most likely to cause the greatest inaccuracy in ADF bearings ?

Which one of the following errors can be compensated for by a NAVSTAR/GPS receiver comparing L1 and L2
frequencies ?
Which one of the following inputs to an Area Navigation System ( R-NAV ) comes from an external , not on-board system ?

Which one of the following is an advantage of a Microwave Landing System ( MLS ) compared with an Instrument Landing
System ( ILS ) ?
answer: It is insensitive to geographical site and can be installed at sites where it is not possible to use an ILS.
choiceone: It does not require a separate azimuth ( localiser ) and elevation ( azimuth ) transmitter.
choicetwo:
There is no restriction on the number of ground installations that can be operated because there is an
 unlimited number of frequency channels available.
choicethree: The installation does not require to have a separate method ( marker beacons or DME ) to determine range.

question:
Which one of the following is an advantage of a multi-sensor system using inputs from a global navigation satellite system
( GNSS ) and an inertial navigational system ( INS ) ?
answer: The GNSS can be used to update a drifting INS.
choiceone: The only advantage of coupling both systems is double redundancy.
choicetwo: The activation of “Selective Availability” can be recognised by the INS.
choicethree: The average position calculated from data provided by both systems increases overall accuracy.

question:
Which one of the following is an advantages of a multi-sensor system using inputs from a global navigation satellite system
( GNSS ) and an inertial reference system ( IRS ) ?
answer: The GNSS can be used to update the FMS position from a drifting IRS.
choiceone: The activation of “Selective Availability” can be recognised by he INS.
choicetwo: The GNSS is never used as an input in a multi-sensor system.
choicethree: The FMS always uses average position calculated from the GNSS and the IRS.

question: Which one of the following is an advantage of a secondary radar system when compared to a primary radar system ?
answer: The required power of transmission from the ground equipment is reduced.
choiceone: Is not limited to line of sight.
choicetwo:
The relatively small ground antenna transmits no side lobes , thus eliminating the danger of false replies from
 the airborne transponder.
choicethree: Possibility of obtaining speed information for aircraft within range.

question: Which one of the following lists information given by a basic VOR/DME-based Area Navigation System ?
answer: Crosstrack distance , alongtrack distance , angular course deviation.
choicethree: Aircraft position in latitude and longitude.

question:
Which one of the following lists information given by a basic VOR/DME-based Area Navigation System when tracking
inbound to a phantom waypoint ?
choiceone: Aircraft position in latitude and longitude.

question:
Which of the following lists information required to input a waypoint or “Phantom Station” into a basic VOR/DME-based
Area Navigation System ?
answer: Radial and distance from a VOR/DME to the waypoint or “Phantom Station”.
choiceone: Radials from a minimum of two VORs to the waypointor “Phantom Station”.
choicetwo: Magnetic track and distance from the aircraft to the waypoint or “Phantom Station”.
choicethree: Magnetic track and distance to a VOR/DME rom the waypoint or “Phantom Station”.

question:
Which one of the following errors can be compensated for by a NAVSTAR/GPS receiver comparing L1 and L2
frequencies ?

Which one of the following methods is used by a Microwave Landing System ( MLS ) to indicate distance from the runway
threshold ?
choiceone:
Timing the interval between the reception of sequential secondary radar pulses from the MLS station to the
 aircraft.
choicetwo: Measurement of the frequency shift between the MLS azimuth and elevation transmissions.
choicethree:
Timing the interval between the transmission and reception of primary radar pulses from the aircraft to MLS
 station.

question: Which one of the following sensors/systems is self-contained ?
Which one of the statements below is correct regarding the DME ?
answer: The DME operating frequencies are in the UHF frequency band.
choiceone: Two lines of position obtained from two different DME’s give an unambiguous fix.
choicetwo:
The indicated distance is the ground distance measured from the aircraft’s projected position on the ground to
 the DME ground installation.
choicethree: The DME ground station is always co-located with a VOR station.

question: Which range facility associated with the ILS may be identified by a two-letter identification group ?
Which statement about RNAV-routes is correct ?
answer: A method of navigation which permits aircraft operation on any desired flight path.
choiceone:
RNAV-routes are only used in terminal areas in order to make more efficient use of the approach and landing
 facilities of an airport.
choicetwo: All waypoints of RNAV-routes are called phantom stations.
choicethree:
In general RNAV-routes coincide with standard routes in order to make optimum use of the available
 VOR/DME-stations.

question: Which statement about the errors and effects on NDB radio signals is correct ?
answer:
The mountain effect is caused by reflections onto steep slopes of mountainous terrain which may cause big
 errors in the bearing.
choiceone:
Lightning during atmospheric disturbances may cause a reduction of the signal strength that may result in
 only slight bearing errors.
choicetwo: Shore line effects may cause a huge bearing error due to reflection of the radio signal onto steep coasts.
choicethree: Night effect is a result of interference of the surface wave and the space wave causing a reduction in range.

question: Which statement about the interrogation by the DME-interrogator is correct ?
answer: The interrogation does not start before pulse-pairs of the tuned DME-station are received.
choiceone:
The interrogation starts when the interrogator has been warmed up sufficiently , whether pulse-pairs are
 received or not.
choicetwo: The interrogation can only take place if the Echo Protection Circuit has been locked.
choicethree:
The interrogation starts directly after the correct DME-frequency has been selected on the frequency-
 selecting-panel by the pilot.

question: Which statement is correct for homing towards an NDB in an area with constant wind and constant magnetic variation ?
answer: The Relative bearing of the NDB should be kept 000º.
choiceone:
The Relative bearing of the NDB should be equal ( in magnitude and sign ) to the applied Wind Correction
 Angle.
choicetwo: The Relative bearing of the NDB should be equal ( in magnitude and sign ) to the experienced Drift Angle.
choicethree: The Relative bearing of the NDB should be equal to the QDM.

question: Which statement is correct for tracking towards an NDB in an area with constant wind and constant magnetic variation ?
answer: The Relative bearing of the NDB should be equal ( in magnitude and sign ) to the experienced Drift Angle.
choiceone: The Relative bearing of the NDB should be equal to the QDM.
choicetwo:
The Relative bearing of the NDB should be equal ( in magnitude and sign ) to the applied Wind Correction
 Angle.
choicethree: The Relative bearing of the NDB should be kept 000º.

question: Which statement is correct with respect to selections on the transponder control panel ?
answer: With ALT selected a reply in the modes A , C and S can be transmitted.
choiceone: The correct ICAO 24 bits aircraft address code must be inserted on the control panel.
choicetwo: With the selector knobs the four digits of the squawk can be selected using the decimal symbols 0 through 9.
choicethree: With ON selected a reply in the modes A , C and S can be transmitted.

question: Which statement is correct with respect to the different types of VOR ?
answer: A TVOR has a limited range.
choiceone: A CVOR is primarily used for instrument approaches.
choicetwo: A DVOR is less accurate than a CVOR.
choicethree: A VOT is located along an airway with the purpose to provide an in-flight check of the airborne equipment.

question: Which statement is correct with respect to the range of an NDB ?
answer: With propagation over sea the range will be greater than the range with propagation over land.
choiceone: In order to double the range of an NDB , the transmission power should be increased with a factor 16.
choicetwo: The range depends on the altitude of the aircraft.
choicethree:
During the night the range of an NDB will decrease due to the interference of the direct- and earth reflected
 wave.

question: Which statement is true about the use of the Doppler effect in a Doppler VOR ?
answer:
The Doppler effect is used to create a signal which is received by the aircraft’s VOR-receiver as a frequency
 modulated signal.
choiceone:
The Doppler effect is used to create a signal which is received by the aircraft’s VOR-receiver as an amplitude
 modulated signal.
choicetwo: By using the Doppler effect it is also possible to determine the aircraft’s approach speed to the VOR.
choicethree:
By using the Doppler effect it is possible to determine the range of the aircraft from the VOR station more
 accurately.

question: Which statement is true regarding a compass when directly overhead the north magnetic pole ?
answer: the compass tip will point directly down.
choiceone: the horizontal component of the earth’s magnetic field is horizontal.

question: Which statement relating to the stabilization of airborne weather radar antenna is true ?
answer: They are stabilized with respect to the pitch and roll axis but not with respect to the yaw axis.
choiceone: They are stabilized with respect to the pitch , roll , and yaw axis.
choicetwo: The pilot can choose the axes of stabilization with the system’s stabilization selector switch.
choicethree: They are stabilized with respect to the yaw axis , but not with respect to the pitch and roll axis.

question: Which statement with respect to interrogation modes is correct ?
answer: Mode S Broadcast will transmit information to all mode S transponders.
choiceone: Mode S Selective will trigger replies of all mode S transponders. Mode A/C transponders are suppressed.
choicetwo: Mode S Only all-call will trigger transponder replies of all mode A/C/S transponders.
choicethree:
Intermode A/C/S all-call and Intermode A/C only all-call , differ in the pulse spacing used between the P1
 and P3 pulse.

question: Why is a secondary radar display screen free of storm clutter ?
answer: The principle of “echo” return is not used in secondary radar.
choiceone: A moving target indicator facility suppresses the display of static or near static returns.
choicetwo: The frequencies employed are too low to give returns from moisture sources.
choicethree: The frequencies employed are too high to give returns from moisture sources.

question: With mode-S each aircraft can be uniquely interrogated and identified by using the ;
answer: 24 bits address code , giving more than 16 million possible codes.

question: With regard to the range of NDB’s and the accuracy of the bearings they provide can be stated that in general at night ;
answer: the range increases and the accuracy decreases.
choiceone: the range and the accuracy both increase.
choicetwo: the range decreases and the accuracy increases.
choicethree: the range and the acuracy both decrease.

question:

bar will show ;
answer: Full scale deflection left with a “from” indication.
choiceone: Full scale deflection right with a “to” indication.

choicethree: Full scale deflection right with a “from” indication.

question: You are on a magnetic heading of 055° and your ADF indicates a relative bearing of 325°. The QDM is ;

deflection. Relative to the stations , you are situated in a quadrant defined by the radials ;
